intro: Pipturus oreophilus, commonly known as the mountain huckleberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruits are edible berries that are often consumed by birds and small mammals. Pipturus oreophilus plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to soil stability and providing food for wildlife.
